title: Douglass on Quaker activism - historical situation

content.question: Which of the following broader contexts is most helpful for understanding the community support evident in the excerpt?

choices.label: Throughout the late eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries, the free Black population grew in the United States.
The Haitian Revolution inspired revolts by enslaved people in many regions of the African diaspora.
African American creative expression drew upon blended influences from African and European cultures.
In the first half of the nineteenth century, many African Americans were forcibly relocated through the domestic slave trade.

content.answer: Throughout the late eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries, the free Black population grew in the United States.

topic.text: 2.14: Black Organizing in the North: Freedom, Women's Rights, and Education

skill.text: 1.B: Identify and explain the context of a specific event, development, or process.
